security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate API testing tool. The skill provides Python code templates for generating and executing API test scripts. All capabilities (network access, file I/O, subprocess execution) are appropriate for the stated purpose of API testing automation. No obfuscation, credential theft, or suspicious patterns detected.

content.user_title: Generate API test scripts from OpenAPI specs
content.value_statement: Manual API testing is time consuming and error prone. Generate complete Python test scripts that call all API endpoints in dependency-correct order ensuring all requests return 2xx status codes.
actual_capabilities: Parse OpenAPI 3.0+ and GraphQL specifications from URLs or files
Analyze endpoint dependencies and create optimal execution order
Generate complete Python test scripts with HTTP requests library
Execute generated scripts with retry logic and error handling
Support multiple authentication methods (Bearer, API Key, Basic, OAuth2)
Validate responses against JSON schemas from API specifications
limitations: Requires valid API credentials for authentication
Cannot handle endpoints requiring complex multi-step authentication flows
Generated scripts may need manual adjustment for very complex schema definitions

use_cases.title: Integration test automation
use_cases.description: Generate test scripts for CI/CD pipelines to catch API regressions early

best_practices: Provide complete authentication credentials so the generated script can execute successfully
Use parallel execution for APIs with many independent endpoints to speed up testing
Enable detailed reporting when debugging failing endpoints to understand error patterns
anti_patterns: Running generated scripts against production APIs without proper authorization checks
Using real credentials in generated scripts that will be shared or committed to version control
Expecting the skill to handle APIs with complex inter-dependent authentication flows without manual configuration

faq.question: What API specification formats are supported?
faq.answer: OpenAPI 3.0+ and GraphQL schemas. The skill auto-detects the format from file extension or URL.

faq.question: What authentication methods work with this skill?
faq.answer: Bearer tokens, API keys, Basic auth, and OAuth2 client credentials flow are supported out of the box.

faq.question: Can the generated scripts run in CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. Generated Python scripts use standard libraries and can be executed in any CI/CD environment with Python installed.

faq.question: Is my credential data safe?
faq.answer: Credentials are used only to generate test scripts. The skill does not store or transmit credentials to third parties.

faq.question: Why did my script fail with a 400 error?
faq.answer: A 400 error usually means the request body is missing required fields. The skill will attempt to auto-fix by adding common fields.

faq.question: How does this compare to Postman or other testing tools?
faq.answer: This skill generates self-contained Python scripts that can be version controlled. Postman offers a UI but requires more manual setup.
